sn7.6:3.1: 6 With Bhāradvāja of the Matted Hair
sn7.6:4.2: Then the brahmin Bhāradvāja of the Matted Hair went up to the Buddha,
sn7.6:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn7.6:4.5: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn7.6:5.2: these people are tangled up in matted hair.
sn7.6:5.4: Who can untangle this tangled mass?”
sn7.6:7.3: the perfected ones with defilements ended—
sn7.6:8.3: and impingement and perception of form:
sn7.6:8.4: it’s there that the tangle is cut.”
sn7.6:9.1: When he had spoken, Bhāradvāja of the Matted Hair said to the Buddha:
sn7.6:9.3: And Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected.
